_comment: TEMPLATE: Keyboard Navigation Configuration - Copy this file and rename it to '[viewname]-keyboard.json'
_description: Configure keyboard shortcuts and navigation behavior for enhanced keyboard accessibility and power user efficiency.
_usage: Enable the features you want. Set to false to disable specific keyboard behaviors.

_options.enabled: true/false - Enable/disable all keyboard navigation features

_basicNavigation: Core arrow key and cell navigation

_basicNavigationOptions.arrowKeyNavigation: Enable arrow keys (↑↓←→) to navigate between cells
_basicNavigationOptions.autoPageDown: Automatically go to next page when pressing ↓ on last row
_basicNavigationOptions.autoFocusFirst: Automatically focus first cell when table loads
_basicNavigationOptions.announcePosition: Announce current position to screen readers during navigation

_cellInteractions: How users interact with cells via keyboard

_cellInteractionOptions.enterToEdit: Press Enter to edit editable cells
_cellInteractionOptions.enterToSelect: Press Enter to select/deselect rows (conflicts with enterToEdit)
_cellInteractionOptions.tabThroughEditable: Tab key moves between editable cells only

_featureShortcutOptions.searchShortcut: Ctrl+F or / to focus search box
_featureShortcutOptions.refreshShortcut: Ctrl+R or F5 to refresh table data
_featureShortcutOptions.escapeShortcut: Esc to clear selection/cancel editing/close modals
_featureShortcutOptions.pageShortcuts: Page Up/Down, Home/End for quick navigation
_featureShortcutOptions.helpShortcut: ? or F1 to show keyboard shortcuts help dialog

_defaultShortcuts: These are built-in unless you override them

shortcuts._comment: Default shortcuts are pre-configured. Add custom ones in customShortcuts below.

customShortcuts._comment: Example custom shortcut - Delete selected rows

_options.action: Function name to call from custom-handlers.js
_options.description: Help text shown in keyboard shortcuts dialog

customShortcuts._comment: Example custom shortcut - Filter by status

customShortcuts.description: Perform quick action on selected row

_bestPractices: Enable arrowKeyNavigation for accessible table navigation
Set enterToEdit=true OR enterToSelect=true, not both (they conflict)
Use spaceToSelect for row selection to avoid Enter key conflicts
Enable helpShortcut so users can discover available shortcuts
Test keyboard navigation without a mouse to ensure full accessibility
Avoid overriding common browser shortcuts (Ctrl+T, Ctrl+W, etc.)
Document custom shortcuts in your application's help/docs
Use modifier keys (Ctrl, Shift, Alt) to avoid conflicts with typing
Keep shortcuts intuitive and easy to remember
Test shortcuts across different browsers and operating systems
_accessibilityConsiderations: All table functionality must be accessible via keyboard alone
Focus should be clearly visible at all times
Tab order should be logical and predictable
Screen readers should announce keyboard actions
Escape key should always cancel or close active operations
Avoid keyboard traps where users can't tab away
Provide skip links for large tables
Support standard browser shortcuts (don't override them)

_platformDifferences.mac: Cmd key often replaces Ctrl (automatically handled by browser)
_platformDifferences.note: The system automatically handles Cmd/Ctrl differences. Configure using 'ctrl' in settings.

_conflictsToAvoid: Ctrl+F - Browser's find function (override only if necessary)
F5 - Browser refresh (safe to override with your own refresh)
Tab - Natural focus movement (don't override unless for cell navigation)
